block.p: Kristin Carroll Lemkau, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Curt W. Lemkau of Short Hills, N.J., was married yesterday to Craig Areskog Lunde, a son of Martha K. Lunde of Freeport, N.Y., and Henry C. Lunde of Garden City, N.Y. The Rev. Bruce W. Forbes, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at St. Bartholomew's Church in New York.

The bride, 33, will continue to use her name professionally. She is a vice president at J. P. Morgan & Company, where she is the spokeswoman for its investment banking business in New York. She graduated from Vanderbilt University. Her father is the director of insurance products for Lord, Abbett & Company, an asset management concern in Jersey City. Her mother is a real estate agent with the Coldwell Banker office in Summit, N.J. The bride's great-grandfather the late Frederick Aloysius Carroll was the chairman of the International Red Cross during World War II.

Kristin Carroll Lemkau, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Curt W. Lemkau of Short Hills, N.J., was married yesterday to Craig Areskog Lunde, a son of Martha K. Lunde of Freeport, N.Y., and Henry C. Lunde of Garden City, N.Y. The Rev. Bruce W. Forbes, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at St. Bartholomew's Church in New York.

The bride, 33, will continue to use her name professionally. She is a vice president at J. P. Morgan & Company, where she is the spokeswoman for its investment banking business in New York. She graduated from Vanderbilt University. Her father is the director of insurance products for Lord, Abbett & Company, an asset management concern in Jersey City. Her mother is a real estate agent with the Coldwell Banker office in Summit, N.J. The bride's great-grandfather the late Frederick Aloysius Carroll was the chairman of the International Red Cross during World War II.

The bridegroom, 34, is the sales director in the New York office of the Tanning Technology Corporation, an information-technology services provider. He graduated from Yale University. His mother is an administrative assistant at Deutsche Bank in New York. His father retired as the chairman of the science department at Hempstead (N.Y.) High School.
